value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZkL2jo3b_5M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How do I get my Excel users to use Power BI???
value.excerpt: Lots of people use Excel and love it! But what about Power BI? Why not use both together? Patrick looks at how Excel users can take advantage of Power BI and may just start using that!  Start in Excel to connect to Power BI datasets https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-connect-excel-power-bi-datasets
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1yJnmZRTNZg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How do you use RLS with Power BI Embedded???
value.excerpt: Are you using Power BI Embedded and not sure how to implement Row-Level Security (RLS)? Adam shows you how!  Power BI Embedded Doc: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/developer/embedded/embedded-row-level-security  Power BI Embedded Playground: https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/  GitHub

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Learn how the DAX Studio query builder can help you with Power BI
value.excerpt: You may be able to write a DAX expression, but what about an actual DAX query? DAX queries can help you validate data and fine tune your DAX expressions used for Power BI. Patrick shows you how!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI

value.title: Natives Queries or ODBC with Incremental Refresh in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you wanting to use Incremental Refresh in Power BI but need to use ODBC, native queries or something that doesn't fold properly? Adam shows you a solution for Power BI Desktop and Power BI dataflows!  Native Queries https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/native-database-query  Using Incremental Refresh

value.title: NEXT LEVEL Power BI Date Picker!
value.excerpt: Revisiting the Power BI Date Picker. Patrick takes it to the NEXT LEVEL and makes it more efficient!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available to help you with your journey.

value.title: One Click Calculation Group in Power BI
value.excerpt: Calculation Groups in Power BI can be amazing! Patrick shows you how you can create these common patterns with just one click using Tabular Editor.  Blog: https://www.esbrina-ba.com/time-intelligence-the-smart-way/  Calculation Groups: https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/calculation-groups?view=asallproducts-allversions

value.title: Power BI Admin Roles and the Admin Portal
value.excerpt: Adam looks at the Power BI Admin Portal and the roles you need to be able to access and manage your Power BI items. This consists of two potential roles within Azure Active Directory or Office 365.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI Apps for Consumers
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. Power BI Apps are the main way that dashboards and reports are distributed widely in your organization.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/

value.title: Revisiting a Power BI solution with Dynamic M Parameters

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
